snippet: Commissioner Gary Bettman said the N.H.L. and the Players’ Association remained far apart on a new collective bargaining agreement with one month to go before the current contract expires.
abstract: NHL Commissioner Gary Bettman dismisses the Players' Assn proposal for a new collective bargaining agreement, saying the union and management remain far apart with one month to go before the current agreement expires; Bettman has said that the owners will lock out the players if a new agreement is not reached; it would be the third lockout since he became commissioner in 1993.
lead_paragraph: Commissioner Gary Bettman said the N.H.L. and the Players’ Association remained far apart on a new collective bargaining agreement with one month to go before the current contract expires.

headline.seo: N.H.L. Commissioner Gary Bettman Not Impressed With Union’s Offer
headline.main: N.H.L. Commissioner Not Impressed With Union’s Proposal
headline.print_headline: Commissioner Not Impressed With Union’s Offer
